file_content.text: Congratulations, you finally did the smart thing. Do you expect me to be grateful?
You wouldn't have survived the Jedi and Diago without me.
You blasted well better be.
Interesting theory.
If I need to reload my blaster, just say so.
Are we going to fight?
Oh, don't be tedious. I was only teasing.
Keep your feelings to yourself. I just want my reward.
No, I expect you to pay me.
It's always a pleasure to work with an unsentimental mercenary.
I'm counting on it, sweetheart.
[Flirt.] Very.
Your arrogance is simply intoxicating.
Poor Nariel. Never had a moment's pleasure in her brief lifetime. It's almost sad.
I had to kill her. She wasn't gonna leave me alone.
She left me no choice.
Stubbornness is a tragic flaw quite common among Jedi.
Not sure I made the right call here.
I regret it already.
Oh, leave it alone. Remorse is such a tedious emotion.
If we actually cared, I'm sure it would be a tragedy.
Almost.
A shame you aren't Force sensitive. You'd make a lovely Sith.
Speaking of pleasure, I remember you promising me some.
[Flirt.] Enough about her.
And good little boys always get what I promise.
You've been ever so helpful. Let's discuss your compensation.
I need some fresh air. Find me when you're done.
I want no part of this. I'll wait outside.
Tell me your heart's desire, my dear....
Here's a hint: I want something I can use, and it's not you.
Give me something I can spend.
Credits? Really? How crude. Very well.
One word: equipment.
There's no shortage of treasures lying around this cavern, but you want something special, don't you? As you wish.
I think I could learn a few things from you.
I want your time.
A would-be apprentice? How sweet.
I'd be happy to share a few morsels of wisdom with you. Here, settle in next to me....
How do you feel, my dear? Wiser, I hope.
The fashion tips alone were worth it.
Definitely.
Remember what I said about Alderaan. It's the only way you'll get invited to the best parties.
If nothing else, I have a whole list of things to avoid.
Maybe a little.
You're even sicker than I thought.
Disgusted, too.
Always happy to exceed expectations.
I wouldn't call it my heart's desire, but it's close enough.
[Flirt] You know what I want.
I do admire bluntness. So many people waste their lives on subtlety.
This cavern is really quite lovely, you know. Why don't we go for a swim?
That was amazing. I've never had better. Truly, what a wonder.
Try to be a little convincing.
Oh, come on.
I never promised to convince you of anything.
Could've done without that last part, but otherwise I had a good time.
That was fun.
I'm delighted for you.
Wish I could say all those things about you.
What a waste that was.
I believe you received exactly what you asked for.
I believe that concludes our business. I'll take my prize and be on my way.
Such a gorgeous box. A delectable shade of crimson, don't you agree?
What's in that box, anyway?
Tell me about it.
You wouldn't understand.
I don't even want to know what that thing is.
Looks like blood.
Probably not, but I like to think you'll see it in your dreams.
You creep me out.
Oh, you never know. It's a small galaxy.
I'd ask where you plan to spend these credits, but I'm sure the answer isn't the least bit interesting. Goodbye....
Here--I stole this handy little thing from someone I eventually killed. Now it's yours. Enjoy....
Bargaining with you was a pleasure. Farewell....
While I'm pleased Diago finally responded to my provocation, I was expecting a bit more.
Uh, Captain? We've got... something... here.
She makes my fur itch.
Is that absurd little trophy the reason Diago sent you?
I'm here on my own business, lady.
I'm not with Diago.
You ran past the spice storehouses to fetch a bone? Interesting business.
This krayt dragon tooth is the key to Diago's heart. Didn't you know?
[Lie.] Of course.
You're funny. I suppose I can work with that.
I don't believe we've met.
My name is Vaverone Zare. I'm interested in discussing a bargain with Diago Hixan.
I'm trying to get a meeting with Diago, myself.
That makes two of us.
Ah, yes. It's easier to get an appointment with the Dark Council.
I met a Jedi who said you're pure evil.
I was warned about you.
You mean little Nariel? Poor girl. Thinks she's my nemesis. Very sad.
Go ahead.
The man is notoriously hard to reach. That's why I'm allowing you to speak with me.
I've been prodding Diago for weeks. Raid a business here, kill a lieutenant there--but it's like he hasn't noticed.
I thought sending the Geonosians to raid this operation would surely draw him out, but all I've got is you.
Maybe he just doesn't have time for chitchat?
Diago's a busy man.
Grand Moffs tremble before me. How powerful must Diago be to not care what I do to him?
What do you want?
Maybe Diago sent me here to kill you.
[Lie.] It did draw him out.
You're adorable, but I'm not here to fight.
I'm seeking a small crimson box--one curio of many in Diago's personal collection.
I'll give him whatever he wants for the box, but I need to arrange a meeting. Can you do that?
People don't go to war over empty boxes.
What's in the box?
The contents are irrelevant.
Is this a job interview?
If you serve me, you serve yourself.
What do I get if I help you?
Let's pretend I can.
Whoa, Captain. You sure about this? I mean, she's a Sith.
It's a good offer. Who cares where it comes from?
Business is business.
I hope you know what you're doing.
It's not healthy to torque off people with lightsabers.
I'm humoring her.
I see the percentage in that.
If you can't handle this, go wait in the ship.
Shut up or leave.
And leave you alone with her? No way.
When this deal goes sour, I get to say "I told you so."
No good luck comes from this deal.
Good luck is overrated. I'd rather have a reward.
I'm in this for the money.
She'll give you neither.
I'm not stupid, Bowdaar. Nod and smile with me, all right?
Just play along.
You're talking us out of this? Bold.
Quit your whining, Wookiee.
Enough yowling.
Wookiees don't whine.
For your assistance, you'll receive a gift few beings ever enjoy--the pleasure of my company.
You'll be the only member of your species who experiences me as something besides a master.
If you want to pretend like you're not interested, I can offer a more material reward.
And don't deny that you desire me. I'm the closest you'll ever get to perfection.
I offer the chance of a lifetime. All I ask is that you arrange a meeting for me with Diago.
I'd really like to help you--truly--but I can't.
I'm sorry to disappoint you.
As you wish. I hope you survive disappointing me.
I'd rather drink a Hutt's bath water.
I won't. [Attack]
How revolting.
That was fun, but unnecessary. Now run along and reconsider my offer.
Until we meet again....
We can work something out. How do I contact you?
You've got a deal.
I scanned your holofrequency. I'll contact you.
Don't take too long arranging things, or I'll have to employ more aggressive means of getting Diago's attention.
You ever get the feeling we're in over our heads?
Don't worry, Corso. I know what I'm doing.
Everything is under control.
Glad one of us does.
That's what makes this job so much fun.
Always.
You've got an interesting idea of fun.
You can quit whenever, Corso.
I'm no quitter, but I've got a bad feeling about this.
Jedi and Sith before sundown, destruction before sunrise.
You come up with that saying by yourself?
Is that your wisdom?
Not a saying. A warning.
Don't worry so much.
This ends in violence. I can already smell it.
You're getting to be a real pain in the neck, Wookiee.
Quit your complaining.
You need to be more careful.
